title: Battle of Prokhorovka
summary: The Battle of Prokhorovka was fought on 12 July 1943[lower-alpha 1] near Prokhorovka, 87 kilometres (54Â mi) southeast of Kursk, in the Soviet Union, during the Second World War. Taking place on the Eastern Front, the engagement was part of the wider Battle of Kursk and occurred when the 5th Guards Tank Army of the Soviet Red Army attacked the II SS-Panzer Corps of the German Waffen-SS in one of the largest tank battles in military history.[lower-alpha 11]
